item.title: Oppo Find N5 Specifications Have Reportedly Been Leaked: From Design & Camera To Battery, Here's What We Know - ABP Live
item.description:
Oppo Find N5 Specifications Have Reportedly Been Leaked: From Design & Camera To Battery

Publication Date: 2024-12-01 Source: Tech News

As Oppo gears up for 2025, key specifications of the Find N5 have reportedly been leaked, hinting at significant improvements over its predecessor.

  • 6.4-inch external display with 120Hz refresh rate and 8-inch main screen with 2K resolution.
  • Powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Elite processor and a 5700mAh battery with 80W wired charging.
  • Rumored 50W wireless charging support.
  • Triple-camera system with three 50MP sensors for versatile photography.
  • Expected configurations up to 16GB RAM and 1TB storage.
“These leaked specifications should be taken cautiously, as Oppo has yet to officially confirm any details.”

Speculation suggests an official announcement will occur shortly after the Chinese New Year in 2025, possibly in February.

item.title: Breaking: Dil Raju announces Game Changer trailer launch date - 123telugu
item.description:
Dil Raju Announces Game Changer Trailer Launch Date

Published on Dec 29, 2024 at 7:04 pm IST | Source: 123Telugu

Ram Charan's forthcoming political drama, Game Changer, is set for theatrical release on January 10, with the trailer launching on January 1.

  • Producer Dil Raju announced the trailer release date amid fan festivities.
  • The trailer will feature a 2'45 minute duration showcasing Ram Charan's “Nata Viswaroopam”.
  • The film's teaser highlighted Ram Charan in a dual role, promising a grand cinematic experience.
  • Collaborations include Kiara Advani and renowned director Shankar.
“Fans will witness Ram Charan’s ‘Nata Viswaroopam’ in the trailer.” - Dil Raju

The upcoming trailer is highly anticipated, following the buzz generated by the teaser and the film's star-studded cast.

item.title: ‘Physical relations’ cannot automatically mean sexual assault, rules Delhi High court - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Physical relations’ cannot automatically mean sexual assault, rules Delhi High court

Publication Date: Dec 29, 2024 - Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi High Court acquitted a man accused under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO), stating that the phrase 'physical relations' used by the minor cannot automatically be interpreted as sexual assault. The court highlighted the need for concrete evidence rather than assumptions in such cases.

  • The ruling was made by Justices Pratibha M Singh and Amit Sharma.
  • The accused had initially been sentenced to life imprisonment.
  • The court emphasized the absence of clarity on the term 'physical relations' as used by the minor.
The court stated, "The mere fact that the survivor is below 18 years cannot lead to a conclusion that there was penetrative sexual assault."

This ruling raises important questions about definitions and interpretations in sexual assault cases, especially regarding minors. The court's decision to acquit the accused based on the nuances of language highlights the complexities involved in such legal matters.

item.title: EV financing no longer risky, says Shriram Finance's executive vice chairman Umesh Revankar | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
EV Financing Considered Low Risk, Says Shriram Finance Executive

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Mint

Umesh Revankar, executive vice-chairman of Shriram Finance, discusses the current landscape of electric vehicle financing, highlighting its low risk status compared to five years ago.

  • Revankar asserts that established manufacturers are enhancing the reliability of EV technology.
  • He believes that growing infrastructure alongside innovative large entities will drive change in the EV market.
  • The trend of reliable financing is being observed across two-wheeler and three-wheeler segments as well.
"Once large entities come and build technology, reliability and infrastructure, then automatically that industry goes for a big change."

This analysis suggests a positive shift towards financing electric vehicles as market confidence grows.

item.title: South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: Seven day national mourning declared till Jan 4 - The Indian Express
item.description:
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates

Date & Source: December 24, 2024, Indian Express

In an emergency meeting on Sunday, South Korea’s acting President Choi Sang-mok declared a national mourning period until January 4 following the deadly plane crash at Muan International Airport that killed 179. All on board except two crew members are feared dead as a plane carrying 181 passengers and six crew on a flight from Bangkok crashed and burst into flames early Sunday.

The crash site has been declared a special disaster zone.

  • A Jeju Air flight veered off the runway while landing and exploded into flames.
  • The airline is gathering information regarding the casualties and causes of the accident.
  • Two Thai nationals were among the 175 passengers, with the rest believed to be South Koreans.
“The government would like to offer its sincere condolences to the bereaved families and will do its best to recover from this accident and prevent a recurrence.” - Choi Sang-mok

This tragic incident has raised significant concerns regarding aviation safety measures in South Korea.

item.title: Baby John Box Office Day 4: Varun Dhawan's Film Earns ₹23.90 Crore, Faces Heat From Pushpa 2 - News18
item.description:
Baby John Box Office Day 4: Varun Dhawan's Film Earns ₹23.90 Crore, Faces Heat From Pushpa 2

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: News18

Varun Dhawan’s film Baby John shows signs of recovery at the box office, earning ₹4.25 crore on Day 4 for a total of ₹23.90 crore, despite facing heavy competition from Pushpa 2.

  • The film had an underwhelming debut, earning ₹11.25 crore on its opening day.
  • Box office collections declined by 57.78% on Thursday and another 23% on Friday.
  • Pushpa 2 continues to dominate, earning ₹12.5 crore on the same day.
  • Critics have given mixed reviews, praising the cast, especially Dhawan, but criticizing the slow pacing and plot predictability.
“What stands out most in Baby John is its stellar casting. Kudos to the casting director! Varun Dhawan shines as DCP Satya Verma.”

Despite the modest recovery, Baby John remains overshadowed by its competitor, indicating a challenging box office journey ahead.

item.title: Fintech’s new fuel: Venture debt takes centrestage amid a funding crunch | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Fintech’s New Fuel: Venture Debt Takes Centre Stage Amid a Funding Crunch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Company Business News

As venture capital investments into India’s financial technology sector plunged this year, fintech companies are increasingly turning to venture debt as an alternative funding source.

  • Venture debt allows early-stage companies to raise capital without diluting equity.
  • Venture debt is becoming more prevalent as venture capital becomes scarce due to regulatory oversight.
  • Despite the rise of venture debt, venture capital remains the primary financing method for startups.
"Venture debt is essentially a high-interest loan advanced to early stage companies that want to raise capital without diluting equity."

The growing use of venture debt highlights a shift in the fintech funding landscape caused by changing regulatory dynamics.

item.title: Azerbaijan president says Russia shot the plane that crashed in Kazakhstan killing 38 - The Times of India
item.description:
Azerbaijan says crashed plane was shot at from Russia, accuses Kremlin of hiding facts

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: [Source Name]

Azerbaijan has alleged that a plane that crashed was targeted by gunfire from Russian territory and claimed that the Kremlin is not providing full transparency about the incident.

  • Azerbaijan's statement indicates a serious diplomatic tension with Russia.
  • Officials have called for a thorough investigation into the circumstances surrounding the crash.
  • The Azerbaijani government is seeking to hold those responsible accountable.
"We demand answers and accountability on how this could happen," a government spokesperson stated.

This incident further strains relations between Azerbaijan and Russia, highlighting ongoing geopolitical tensions in the region.

item.title: Pranab Mukherjee's daughter takes ‘real rot’ jibe at Congress: ‘Why no CWC…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over CWC Meeting for Her Father's Death

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Sharmistha Mukherjee, daughter of the late former president Pranab Mukherjee, has expressed her dissatisfaction with the Congress party for not convening a Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting to mourn her father’s death in August 2020. She criticized the party’s current state and called for introspection.

  • Mukherjee stated that Congress workers feel alienated from the leadership.
  • She compared the absence of a condolence meeting for her father to past practices regarding deceased leaders.
  • Sharmistha accused Congress of trolling her over her comments about the party’s direction.
  • Her remarks highlight a rift between party ideology and current leadership approaches.
“There is a real rot in the Congress,” said Mukherjee regarding the party's handling of her father's death.

In conclusion, Sharmistha Mukherjee’s comments indicate a significant discontent with the direction of the Congress party and the perceived neglect of traditional practices.

item.title: 12 questions you should ask your doctor to boost brain health in 2025 - The Times of India
item.description:
12 Questions to Boost Your Brain Health in 2025

Publication Date: 2025

Source: The American Academy of Neurology

As we step into 2025, it is crucial to focus on brain health as part of overall wellness. The American Academy of Neurology identifies 12 factors vital for maintaining brain health, which patients are encouraged to discuss with their physicians.

  • Sleep: Sufficient rest is essential for brain function.
  • Mood and mental health: Concerns about anxiety or stress should be addressed.
  • Diet: Ensure a nutritious diet and consider supplements.
  • Exercise: Incorporate physical activity into daily life.
  • Social interactions: Maintain regular contact with friends and family for support.
  • Trauma avoidance: Use protective measures such as seatbelts.
  • Blood pressure: Monitor and discuss any concerns regarding blood pressure.
  • Genetic risks: Be aware of family history of neurological diseases.
  • Medication cost: Address any financial difficulties in accessing medicines.
  • Vaccination: Stay updated on necessary vaccines.
  • Substance exposure: Be mindful of alcohol, smoking, and pollution exposure.
  • Social determinants: Discuss issues regarding housing and transportation access.
“Neurologists are the experts in brain health, with the training and insight needed to help you keep your brain in top shape throughout life.” – Carlayne E. Jackson, M.D., FAAN

Engaging in these discussions with healthcare providers can lead to personalized strategies for enhancing brain health.

item.title: Updated World Test Championship Points Table After South Africa Defeat Pakistan - What Does It Mean .. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Updated World Test Championship Points Table After South Africa Defeat Pakistan - What Does It Mean For India?

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

South Africa booked their spot in the World Test Championship (WTC) Final after a gritty two-wicket victory over Pakistan. This result keeps South Africa at the top of the points table, while India fights to secure their spot.

  • South Africa defeated Pakistan by two wickets in the first Test match in Centurion.
  • Kagiso Rabada and Marco Jansen's partnership led to the victory.
  • South Africa maintains a PCT of 66.67 in the WTC standings.
  • Australia is slightly ahead of India in the race for the second WTC spot.
  • If the series against Australia ends 1-1, India still has a chance to qualify for the WTC Final.
“Kagiso Rabada and Marco Jansen shared an unbeaten 51-run ninth wicket partnership.”

The implications of this match are significant as India seeks to keep its World Test Championship hopes alive amidst a tight competition.

item.title: Know the educational qualification and net worth of India star cricketer Nitish Kumar Reddy - India.com
item.description:
Nitish Kumar Reddy: Education and Net Worth of Rising Star Cricketer

Publication Date: Not specified Source: India.com

Nitish Kumar Reddy, a promising cricketer for India, celebrated his first Test century in Melbourne, raising his profile as a future star in Indian cricket.

  • Nitish scored his maiden Test century during a recent match in Melbourne.
  • He has B.Tech in Electronics and Communication and a master’s in business analytics.
  • The cricketer resides in Visakhapatnam with his family.
  • His net worth is estimated between Rs 8 to 15 crore.
  • Nitish plays for Sunrisers Hyderabad in IPL at a retained price of Rs 6 crore.
  • He has expressed admiration for fellow cricketer Virat Kohli.
  • Nitish owns high-end bikes, showcasing his passion for motorcycles.
  • He made his IPL debut in 2023 and has performed commendably in the tournament.
Nitish Kumar Reddy's net worth is between Rs 8 to 15 crore.

This article highlights the ascent of Nitish Kumar Reddy in Indian cricket, emphasizing his educational background and financial success following his impressive performances.

item.title: Stock market weekly recap: NIFTY, SENSEX cut losses in holiday-shortened week amid caution - Upstox
item.description:
Stock market weekly recap: NIFTY, SENSEX cut losses in holiday-shortened week amid caution

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: Upstox

As 2024 nears its end, Indian stock markets demonstrate recovery with NIFTY and SENSEX gaining up to 1% in a holiday-shortened week dominated by cautious investor sentiment.

  • NIFTY and SENSEX recovered from previous losses to close in the green.
  • FIIs have sold equities worth over ₹3 lakh crore in 2024.
  • NIFTY Auto, FMCG, and Pharma sectors led gains this week.
  • Market hovered around mixed performances due to profit-taking and trading holidays.
  • Sagility India shares extended their winning streak, rallying nearly 75% since listing.
  • One Mobikwik Systems stock surged over 28%, reaching an all-time high.
“The foreign investors have sold equities worth ₹1.14 lakh crore on a net basis in October alone.”

Looking ahead, investors anticipate thin trading with a focus on FII activity and upcoming Q3 results, which may shape market trends.

item.title: South Africa qualify for WTC final; here’s what India and Australia need to do to book their ticket to Lord's - Hindustan Times
item.description:
South Africa seal qualification for the WTC final after beating Pakistan in the first Test.

Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

South Africa has officially qualified for the World Test Championship (WTC) final, to be held at Lord's in June 2025, after a dramatic victory over Pakistan.

  • South Africa defeated Pakistan by two wickets in the first Test.
  • Kagiso Rabada and Marco Jansen played crucial roles in the victory.
  • This win secures South Africa’s place at the top of the WTC standings.
  • India and Australia now face pressure to secure their qualification, with critical matches on the horizon.
“This result has put more pressure on India and Australia.”

Looking ahead, both India and Australia must navigate their remaining matches carefully to qualify for the final, with numerous scenarios affecting their standings.

item.title: Malayalam film and TV actor Dileep Shankar found dead in hotel room; actor Seema G Nair pays tribute - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Malayalam Actor Dileep Shankar Found Dead in Hotel Room

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Dileep Shankar, a prominent Malayalam film and TV actor, was found dead in a hotel room in Thiruvananthapuram. He had been shooting for a TV show and was reportedly not seen for two days prior to his death.

  • Dileep checked into the hotel four days ago while shooting for the show 'Panchagni'.
  • Hotel staff discovered him unresponsive after noticing a foul smell.
  • The police are investigating, but no foul play is suspected at this time.
  • Director Manoj mentioned that Dileep had health issues and missed calls from cast members.
  • Actor Seema G Nair expressed her grief on social media, reflecting on their last conversation.
“What happened to you Dileep…why did this happen, God, I don’t even know what to write…my tributes to you.” - Seema G Nair

The incident has left the Malayalam entertainment community in shock as they remember Dileep's contributions to film and television.

item.title: 10 iconic pictures shared by Nasa in 2024 - India Today
item.description:
10 Iconic Pictures Shared by NASA in 2024

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India Today

NASA has shared a collection of ten iconic images, showcasing significant moments and phenomena captured throughout the year 2024. This highlights the advancements in space exploration and the beauty of our universe.

  • Perseverance Mars rover captures the rim of Jezero Crater on November 11, 2024.
  • A total solar eclipse witnessed from NASA's Glenn Research Center on April 8, 2024.
  • A partial solar eclipse as seen from Washington, D.C.
  • Photograph of Razazah Lake in Iraq, reflecting vivid hues.
  • An astronaut's view of the Arabian Peninsula from the International Space Station.
  • Cyclone Chido causes devastation in Mayotte on December 14, 2024.
  • Northrop Grumman's Cygnus cargo craft approaches the International Space Station.
  • Russian cosmonaut Alexey Ovchinin conducts a spacewalk.
  • The Large Magellanic Cloud captured from space.
  • Winter ice formations observed from the space station.
“A total solar eclipse swept across a narrow portion of the North American continent from Mexico’s Pacific coast to the Atlantic coast.”

This collection not only showcases NASA's continuing efforts in space discovery but also captures the majestic beauty of cosmic events throughout the year, inspiring further interest in space exploration.

item.title: Four eclipses predicted for 2025, but only one visible from India, according to Ujjain observatory - India TV News
item.description:
Four Eclipses Predicted for 2025, Only One Visible from India

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: India TV News

In 2025, two solar and two lunar eclipses will occur, but only one will be visible from India, as per the Jiwaji Observatory in Ujjain.

  • The first event is a total lunar eclipse on March 14, not visible in India.
  • A partial solar eclipse on March 29 will also be invisible from India.
  • A full lunar eclipse on September 7-8 will be observable in India.
  • The final event is a partial solar eclipse on September 21-22, which won't be visible from India.
The sun's activity is expected to remain elevated throughout 2025, coinciding with the solar maximum of Solar Cycle 25, associated with an increase in solar flares and geomagnetic storms.

This year sees an intriguing mix of astronomical events for enthusiasts, with significant implications due to heightened solar activity.

item.title: 'Why can't people own the dollars' Deepak Shenoy debates RBI restriction on mutual funds investing in foreign stocks | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Why can’t people own the dollars

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Deepak Shenoy, CEO of Capitalmind, calls for the RBI to increase mutual funds' foreign stock investment limit from $8 billion to $50 billion, pointing out the inconsistencies with individual investment limits.

  • Shenoy argues that the current limit has been unchanged since 2009.
  • Individuals can invest up to $250,000 per year with foreign brokers while mutual funds are restricted.
  • He highlights the inconvenience for investors needing to use foreign brokers for foreign investments.
  • Shenoy states, 'Instead of $8 billion, make it $50 billion.'
“Why do we still have restrictions on Indian mutual funds investing in foreign stocks, when we can do the same thing as individuals...?” — Deepak Shenoy

Shenoy emphasizes that the RBI should reconsider its stance as individual ownership aligns with national ownership of assets.

item.title: South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: All except 2 presumed dead, say authorities after plane veers off runway at South Korea airport - The Indian Express
item.description:
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates

Date: Early Sunday
Source: Reuters

Authorities report that all except two crew members are feared dead after a plane carrying 175 passengers crashed and erupted into flames while landing.

  • The accident happened around 9 am local time at Muan International Airport, South Jeolla Province.
  • The flight was a Jeju Air Boeing 737-800, operating from Bangkok to South Korea.
  • 120 bodies have been recovered so far, and the incident is noted as the worst air accident involving a South Korean airline in nearly three decades.
  • The aircraft failed to land correctly and crashed into a wall, leading to an explosion.
  • Recovery efforts are underway, as the acting President ordered all-out rescue operations.
“It is the worst air accident involving a South Korean airline in nearly three decades and it is on track to become the country’s deadliest ever.”

As recovery efforts continue, the focus remains on identifying the casualties and understanding the cause of this tragic incident.

item.title: Advantage Australia as batting gets harder at the MCG? - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Australia Takes Lead in Boxing Day Test at the MCG

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

The Boxing Day Test is nearing a thrilling finish as Australia holds a significant lead against India, with all outcomes still possible on the final day.

  • Australia leads by 333 runs with one wicket in hand.
  • They struggled at one point, being 91 for 6, but rallied to set a challenging target for India.
  • Marnus Labuschagne scored 70 runs and stated that the team felt ahead throughout the match.
  • The pitch's condition is affecting batting performance as the Test progresses into the fifth day.
“I felt like we were probably ahead of the game just the whole way,” said Marnus Labuschagne.

India plans to rectify their earlier mistakes as they prepare for a challenging chase.

item.title: Pushpa 2 (Hindi) Box Office: Is back in DOUBLE DIGIT SCORE, crosses Rs. 750 crores milestone - Bollywood Hungama
item.description:
Pushpa 2 (Hindi) Box Office: Crosses Rs. 750 Crores Milestone

Date & Source: Not specified

The film Pushpa 2: The Rule has crossed the Rs. 750 crores mark at the box office in just 24 days, showcasing impressive growth and aiming for more milestones ahead.

  • The film is now scoring in double digits after a brief pause.
  • It grossed Rs. 10.50 crores on Saturday, surpassing the day's earnings of Baby John.
  • Current box office total stands at Rs. 768.75 crores, with expectations to reach closer to Rs. 15 crores today.
  • The film is poised to enter the Rs. 800 Crore Club soon.
“An All Time Mega Blockbuster.”

Pushpa 2 continues to dominate at the box office, signaling its potential for further successes.

item.title: ‘Deeply saddened’: India's message for families of South Korea plane crash victims - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India Expresses Condolences to Victims of South Korea Plane Crash

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

India has expressed deep sorrow over the tragic plane crash in Muan, South Korea, which has resulted in at least 176 fatalities. The Indian Embassy stated its condolences and solidarity with the victims' families and the South Korean government during this difficult time.

  • A plane crash in Muan, South Korea, has claimed the lives of 176 out of 181 passengers.
  • The aircraft, a Boeing 737-800, reportedly lost control during landing due to landing gear failure.
  • The crash occurred amid a political crisis in South Korea, with emergency meetings held by government officials.
  • India's ambassador to South Korea, Amit Kumar, voiced heartfelt condolences to the victims' families.
“I believe no words of consolation would suffice for the bereaved families who have suffered this tragedy,” said South Korea's acting president Choi Sang-mok.

This tragic incident highlights the urgent need for thorough investigations and support for those affected, as the South Korean government mobilizes resources to assist the grieving families.

item.title: Murzin Wins Rapid World Championship, Humpy Earns 2nd Title In Women's - Chess.com
item.description:
Murzin Wins Rapid World Championship, Humpy Earns 2nd Title In Women's

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Chess.com

Grandmaster Volodar Murzin won the 2024 FIDE World Rapid Chess Championship with an undefeated score of 10/13, becoming the second-youngest rapid world champion in history at 18 years old. Meanwhile, GM Koneru Humpy made an impressive comeback after losing her first game, finishing with 8.5/11 to win the 2024 FIDE Women's World Rapid Chess Championship and secure her second title in this category.

  • Murzin dominated the tournament, defeating notable players including GM Fabiano Caruana.
  • Humpy's victory is remarkable as she was previously in a low state, considering retirement.
  • The championships saw participation from top grandmasters, including Magnus Carlsen.
  • Upcoming events include the FIDE World Blitz Chess Championships starting on December 30, 2024.
“I hope this is not a dream. I don't know what to say. I am really happy.” - Volodar Murzin, after becoming the 2024 FIDE World Rapid Champion.

This year’s event highlighted the rising competitors from Russia and India, marking significant milestones in their chess history.

item.title: Simon Katich's Reaction After Jasprit Bumrah Takes Travis Head's Wicket Goes Viral | Watch - News18
item.description:
Simon Katich's Viral Reaction to Jasprit Bumrah's Wicket

Date: December 29, 2024 Source: News18

In a recent commentary session, Simon Katich celebrated Jasprit Bumrah's spectacular wicket of Travis Head during the ongoing Boxing Day Test, which went viral on social media.

  • Bumrah dismissed Travis Head for 1 run from two balls.
  • Katich, celebrating in the commentary box, expressed his admiration for Bumrah's bowling skills.
  • Head had previously been dismissed for a duck in the first innings.
  • Bumrah’s performance in this Test has been historic, breaking records for wicket-taking in SENA countries.
“It’s official, King Bumrah. The Boxing Day nightmare continues for Travis Head,” Simon Katich remarked during his commentary.

Bumrah's remarkable performance solidifies his status as one of the top bowlers in international cricket.

item.title: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) to be inaugurated on April 17, domestic flights from May - The Times of India
item.description:
Navi Mumbai International Airport Set to Open on April 17, Domestic Flights Begin in May

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: [Insert Source]

The Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) is scheduled for inauguration on April 17, with domestic flights expected to commence in May. This marks a significant development in enhancing air connectivity in the region.

  • The airport aims to relieve congestion at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport.
  • It is expected to support the growing demand for air travel in and out of Mumbai.
  • The first phase of operations will start with domestic flights, with plans for international services to follow.
“The NMIA will transform the aviation landscape in Mumbai and surrounding areas,” said a spokesperson from the airport authority.

This airport is expected to boost local economy and tourism, connecting more passengers and increasing operational capacity.
